page.title: 07The Haffenden's Weekend
page.content: The weekend starts on Friday evening. Louise(11) and Tim(9) go to the Church Choir practise at East Hoathly or Chiddingly. Mum tidies the house and puts Rowan(2) to bed then she gardens or irons before shutting the ducks in. Dad goes back to his workshop or visits the local pub. On Saturday the children play or mow the lawn. Dad works and Mum makes lunch for 1.0p.m. The afternoon is spent either shopping in a local town, at a fete or gardening or visiting friends. After a high tea at 6.00p.m. the family spend the evening at home. Sunday morning after a cooked breakfast the children go to church. Dad does his paperwork and Mum cooks the roast dinner. In the afternoon they visit grandparents or go sailing in their dinghy or into their wood to cook supper over an open fire.
